question_text: Why would a passive DVI-to-VGA adapter fail to produce an image when used with a DVI-D port?
answer_options: DVI-D does not supply power for VGA adapters
DVI-D transmits only digital signals and cannot output analog
VGA cables require a dual-link signal for compatibility
DVI-D is incompatible with any resolution above 800x600
correct_answer: DVI-D transmits only digital signals and cannot output analog
explanation: DVI-D lacks the analog signal pins necessary to output a VGA-compatible signal, so passive adapters wonâ€™t function.
